name: French-Style Soft, Spoonable Scrambled Eggs
description: This recipe produces very delicate scrambled eggs with tiny curds and a spoonable, almost pourable consistency. It's not your average breakfast-egg recipe, but works great spooned onto toasts and topped with things like caviar, smoked salmon, or lobster, as an hors d'oeuvre.
recipeYield: Serves 1 as a meal, or makes enough eggs for about 10 small toasts
recipeIngredient: 2 tablespoons (30ml) cream or milk (optional; see note)
Freshly ground white or black pepper

recipeInstructions.text: In a small saucepan, combine eggs, salt, butter, and milk or cream, if using. Set over low heat and cook, whisking constantly, until eggs thicken to a custardy consistency, 5 to 10 minutes. Remove from heat, season with pepper, and serve right away.
